thread.title: 5 Ole Miss students charged after beating of fellow student
thread.title_full: 5 Ole Miss students charged after beating of fellow student - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: 5 Ole Miss students charged after beating of fellow student
text:
OXFORD, Miss. (AP) - Five University of Mississippi students have been arrested following the Oct. 6 beating of another student.
A university police report shows the beating happened around 4 a.m. at the Sigma Pi fraternity house, where junior accounting major Jeremy Boyle is a member.
Tucker Cole Steil was charged Friday with felony assault in the beating of Boyle. The Oxford Eagle ( http://bit.ly/1W7r2Qb ) reports Steil posted $10,000 bail and was released from the Lafayette County jail.
Four other students are charged with misdemeanors. James Declan Basile is charged with simple assault, hazing and larceny. Christian Guy, Kyle Hughes and Austin Rice are each charged with larceny.
The Daily Mississippian ( http://bit.ly/1PEmIsP ) reports Boyle suffered a concussion, broken teeth, a ruptured eardrum and a lung contusion. He was treated at an Oxford hospital and released.
This story corrects the spelling of last name of Tucker Cole Steil instead of Steill.
